  21. class UserMediaImageViewMixin(object):
  22. """
  23. Mixin for views that deal with `UserMediaImage` objects.
  25. When using this mixin please make sure that you call `_add_next_and_user()`
  26. in your `dispatch()` method.
  28. """
  29. model = UserMediaImage
  31. def _add_next_and_user(self, request):
  32. self.next = request.POST.get('next', '') or request.GET.get('next', '')
  33. self.user = request.user
  35. def get_context_data(self, **kwargs):
  36. """
  37. Adds `next` to the context.
  39. This makes sure that the `next` parameter doesn't get lost if the
  40. form was submitted invalid.
  42. """
  43. ctx = super(UserMediaImageViewMixin, self).get_context_data(**kwargs)
  44. ctx.update({
  45. 'action': self.action,
  46. 'next': self.next,
  47. })
  48. return ctx
  50. def get_success_url(self):
  51. """
  52. Returns the success URL.
  54. This is either the given `next` URL parameter or the content object's
  55. `get_absolute_url` method's return value.
  57. """
  58. if self.next:
  59. return self.next
  60. if self.object and self.object.content_object:
  61. return self.object.content_object.get_absolute_url()
  62. raise Exception(
  63. 'No content object given. Please provide ``next`` in your POST'
  64. ' data')
  67. class CreateImageView(AjaxResponseMixin, UserMediaImageViewMixin, CreateView):
  68. action = 'create'
  69. form_class = UserMediaImageForm
  70. ajax_template_prefix = 'partials/ajax_'
  72. @method_decorator(login_required)
  73. def dispatch(self, request, *args, **kwargs):
  74. """Adds useful objects to the class and performs security checks."""
  75. self._add_next_and_user(request)
  76. self.content_object = None
  77. self.content_type = None
  78. self.object_id = kwargs.get('object_id', None)
  80. if kwargs.get('content_type'):
  81. # Check if the user forged the URL and posted a non existant
  82. # content type
  83. try:
  84. self.content_type = ContentType.objects.get(
  85. model=kwargs.get('content_type'))
  86. except ContentType.DoesNotExist:
  87. raise Http404
  89. if self.content_type:
  90. # Check if the user forged the URL and tries to append the image to
  91. # an object that does not exist
  92. try:
  93. self.content_object = \
  94. self.content_type.get_object_for_this_type(
  95. pk=self.object_id)
  96. except ObjectDoesNotExist:
  97. raise Http404
  99. if self.content_object and hasattr(self.content_object, 'user'):
  100. # Check if the user forged the URL and tries to append the image to
  101. # an object that does not belong to him
  102. if not self.content_object.user == self.user:
  103. raise Http404
  105. return super(CreateImageView, self).dispatch(request, *args, **kwargs)
  107. def get_context_data(self, **kwargs):
  108. ctx = super(CreateImageView, self).get_context_data(**kwargs)
  109. ctx.update({
  110. 'content_type': self.content_type,
  111. 'object_id': self.object_id,
  112. })
  113. return ctx
  115. def get_form_kwargs(self):
  116. kwargs = super(CreateImageView, self).get_form_kwargs()
  117. kwargs.update({
  118. 'user': self.user,
  119. 'content_type': self.content_type,
  120. 'object_id': self.object_id,
  121. })
  122. return kwargs
  125. class DeleteImageView(AjaxResponseMixin, UserMediaImageViewMixin, DeleteView):
  126. """Deletes an `UserMediaImage` object."""
  127. action = 'delete'
  128. model = UserMediaImage
  129. ajax_template_prefix = 'partials/ajax_'
  131. @method_decorator(login_required)
  132. def dispatch(self, request, *args, **kwargs):
  133. """Adds useful objects to the class."""
  134. self._add_next_and_user(request)
  135. return super(DeleteImageView, self).dispatch(request, *args, **kwargs)
  137. def get_context_data(self, **kwargs):
  138. ctx = super(DeleteImageView, self).get_context_data(**kwargs)
  139. ctx.update({
  140. 'image_pk': self.object.pk,
  141. })
  142. return ctx
  144. def get_queryset(self):
  145. """
  146. Making sure that a user can only delete his own images.
  148. Even when he forges the request URL.
  150. """
  151. queryset = super(DeleteImageView, self).get_queryset()
  152. queryset = queryset.filter(user=self.user)
  153. return queryset
  156. class UpdateImageView(AjaxResponseMixin, UserMediaImageViewMixin, UpdateView):
  157. """Updates an existing `UserMediaImage` object."""
  158. action = 'update'
  159. model = UserMediaImage
  160. form_class = UserMediaImageForm
  161. ajax_template_prefix = 'partials/ajax_'
  163. @method_decorator(login_required)
  164. def dispatch(self, request, *args, **kwargs):
  165. """Adds useful objects to the class."""
  166. self._add_next_and_user(request)
  167. return super(UpdateImageView, self).dispatch(request, *args, **kwargs)
  169. def get_context_data(self, **kwargs):
  170. ctx = super(UpdateImageView, self).get_context_data(**kwargs)
  171. ctx.update({
  172. 'content_type': self.object.content_type,
  173. 'object_id': self.object.object_id,
  174. 'image_pk': self.object.pk,
  175. })
  176. return ctx
  178. def get_form_kwargs(self):
  179. kwargs = super(UpdateImageView, self).get_form_kwargs()
  180. kwargs.update({
  181. 'user': self.user,
  182. 'content_type': self.object.content_type,
  183. 'object_id': self.object.object_id,
  184. })
  185. return kwargs
  187. def get_queryset(self):
  188. """
  189. Making sure that a user can only edit his own images.
  191. Even when he forges the request URL.
  193. """
  194. queryset = super(UpdateImageView, self).get_queryset()
  195. queryset = queryset.filter(user=self.user)
  196. return queryset
  199. class AJAXMultipleImageUploadView(CreateView):
  200. """Ajax view to handle the multiple image upload."""
  201. model = UserMediaImage
  202. form_class = UserMediaImageForm
  204. @method_decorator(login_required)
  205. def dispatch(self, request, *args, **kwargs):
  206. self.obj_id = kwargs.get('obj_id', None)
  207. self.user = request.user
  209. if not request.is_ajax():
  210. # Since we use a jquery modal and a jquery upload we should only
  211. # allow ajax calls
  212. raise Http404
  214. # Check if the user posted a non existant content type
  215. try:
  216. self.c_type = ContentType.objects.get(model=kwargs.get('c_type'))
  217. except ContentType.DoesNotExist:
  218. raise Http404
  220. # Check if the content object exists
  221. try:
  222. self.content_object = self.c_type.get_object_for_this_type(
  223. pk=self.obj_id)
  224. except ObjectDoesNotExist:
  225. raise Http404
  227. # Check for permissions
  228. # Add a single user to the content object or prepare a user_can_edit
  229. # function.
  230. if (not hasattr(self.content_object, 'user')
  231. or not self.content_object.user == self.user):
  232. if (not hasattr(self.content_object, 'user_can_edit')
  233. or not self.content_object.user_can_edit(self.user)):
  234. raise Http404
  235. return super(AJAXMultipleImageUploadView, self).dispatch(
  236. request, *args, **kwargs)
  238. def get_form_kwargs(self):
  239. kwargs = super(AJAXMultipleImageUploadView, self).get_form_kwargs()
  240. # Prepare context for UserMediaImage form
  241. kwargs.update({
  242. 'user': self.user,
  243. 'content_type': self.c_type,
  244. 'object_id': self.obj_id,
  245. })
  246. return kwargs
  248. def form_valid(self, form):
  249. # Check if maximum amount of pictures has been reached
  250. try:
  251. max_pictures = int(self.request.POST.get('maximum'))
  252. except (TypeError, ValueError):
  253. max_pictures = getattr(settings, 'USER_MEDIA_UPLOAD_MAXIMUM', 3)
  254. stored_images = self.user.usermediaimage_set.filter(
  255. object_id=self.obj_id, content_type=self.c_type)
  256. if stored_images.count() >= max_pictures:
  257. return HttpResponse(_('Maximum amount limit exceeded.'))
  259. # Save the UserMediaImage
  260. self.object = form.save()
  261. f = self.request.FILES.get('image')
  263. # Generate and get the thumbnail of the uploaded image
  264. thumbnailer = get_thumbnailer(self.object.image.name)
  265. thumb = thumbnailer.get_thumbnail({
  266. 'crop': True, 'upscale': True,
  267. 'size': self.object.small_size(as_string=False),
  268. })
  270. # Prepare context for the list item html
  271. context_data = {
  272. 'image': self.object,
  273. 'mode': 'multiple',
  274. }
  275. context = RequestContext(self.request, context_data)
  277. # Prepare the json response
  278. data = {'files': [{
  279. 'name': f.name,
  280. 'url': self.object.image.url,
  281. 'thumbnail_url': thumb.url,
  282. 'list_item_html': render_to_string(
  283. 'user_media/partials/image.html', context),
  284. }]}
  285. response = HttpResponse(dumps(data), mimetype='application/json')
  286. response['Content-Disposition'] = 'inline; filename=files.json'
  287. return response
  290. class AJAXSingleImageUploadView(FormView):
  291. """Ajax view to handle the single image upload."""
  292. form_class = UserMediaImageSingleUploadForm
  293. template_name = 'user_media/partials/image.html'
  295. @method_decorator(login_required)
  296. def dispatch(self, request, *args, **kwargs):
  297. if not request.is_ajax() or not request.method == 'POST':
  298. raise Http404
  299. self.user = request.user
  300. # Check if the user posted a non existant content type
  301. try:
  302. self.c_type = ContentType.objects.get(model=kwargs.get('c_type'))
  303. except ContentType.DoesNotExist:
  304. raise Http404
  306. # Check if the content object exists
  307. try:
  308. self.content_object = self.c_type.get_object_for_this_type(
  309. pk=kwargs.get('obj_id'))
  310. except ObjectDoesNotExist:
  311. raise Http404
  313. # Check if content_object has the requested image field
  314. if hasattr(self.content_object, kwargs.get('field')):
  315. self.field_name = kwargs.get('field')
  316. else:
  317. raise Http404
  319. # Check for permissions
  320. if (not hasattr(self.content_object, 'user')
  321. or not self.content_object.user == self.user):
  322. if (not hasattr(self.content_object, 'user_can_edit')
  323. or not self.content_object.user_can_edit(self.user)):
  324. raise Http404
  325. return super(AJAXSingleImageUploadView, self).dispatch(
  326. request, *args, **kwargs)
  328. def get_form_kwargs(self):
  329. kwargs = super(AJAXSingleImageUploadView, self).get_form_kwargs()
  330. kwargs.update({
  331. 'instance': self.content_object,
  332. 'image_field': self.field_name,
  333. })
  334. return kwargs
  336. def form_valid(self, form):
  337. # Save the image
  338. self.content_object = form.save()
  339. f = self.request.FILES.get(self.field_name)
  340. image = getattr(self.content_object, self.field_name)
  341. size = getattr(settings, 'USER_MEDIA_THUMB_SIZE_LARGE', (150, 150))
  343. # Generate and get the thumbnail of the uploaded image
  344. thumbnailer = get_thumbnailer(image.name)
  345. thumb = thumbnailer.get_thumbnail({
  346. 'crop': True, 'upscale': True,
  347. 'size': size,
  348. })
  350. # Prepare context for the list item html
  351. context_data = {
  352. 'image': image,
  353. 'mode': 'single',
  354. 'size': (self.request.POST.get('size')
  355. or u'{}x{}'.format(size[0], size[1])),
  356. }
  357. context = RequestContext(self.request, context_data)
  359. # Prepare the json response
  360. data = {'files': [{
  361. 'name': f.name,
  362. 'url': image.url,
  363. 'thumbnail_url': thumb.url,
  364. 'list_item_html': render_to_string(self.template_name, context),
  365. }]}
  366. response = HttpResponse(dumps(data), mimetype='application/json')
  367. response['Content-Disposition'] = 'inline; filename=files.json'
  368. return response
  371. class AJAXImageCropView(UserMediaImageViewMixin, UpdateView):
  372. """Ajax view to update an image's crop attributes."""
  373. @method_decorator(login_required)
  374. def dispatch(self, request, *args, **kwargs):
  375. if not request.is_ajax() or not request.method == 'POST':
  376. raise Http404
  377. self.user = request.user
  378. self.kwargs = kwargs
  379. self.object = self.get_object()
  380. if not self.object.user == self.user:
  381. raise Http404
  382. for field in ['x', 'x2', 'y', 'y2', 'w', 'h']:
  383. # Save the Jcrop values to the image
  384. setattr(self.object, 'thumb_' + field, request.POST.get(field))
  385. self.object.save()
  387. box = (
  388. int(self.object.thumb_x),
  389. int(self.object.thumb_y),
  390. int(self.object.thumb_x2),
  391. int(self.object.thumb_y2),
  392. )
  393. thumbnailer = get_thumbnailer(self.object.image.name)
  394. thumb = thumbnailer.get_thumbnail({
  395. 'box': box,
  396. 'size': self.object.small_size(as_string=False),
  397. })
  398. return HttpResponse(thumb.url)
